column4: i have a question.  how the heck do i install the nomachine NX client?  it's not in any ubuntu apt repository that i know of, and the source built version won't even run
most people use the one from the noMachine site (non-free, but works fine)
it keeps giving me a weird error that libstdc++6 isn't installed, even when it is
i'm just looking into the client.
seveas has made debs for us
do you know where i can find an nxclient .deb compiled for ubuntu?  it's not in the repository that's mentioned in the wiki site you gave me
not off the top of my head, no - I used the one from noMachine
but I tried it a while ago
I honestly don't remember - I just tried it as an experiment - worked well
here's the error i'm getting with the nx client itself.
I can't really help, sorry - I don't know enough about it. If youcame back later possibly Seves could help you
that's ok.  my NX server's not up right now anyway.  it's undergoing its system install
he built the stuff on the wiki page Ipointed you to
all that's there is the freenx server, but not the client itself.
I'm aware of that: I was suggesting you consult Seveas because he is often here and knows about freenx
